Description: Rim and neck sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably a Panathenaic amphora with handle root on right; heavy ovulo lip with flat top. Interior glazed black with added red band at rim; top of rim black; exterior: rim black with red band near top, reserved groove at junction with neck; on neck, top of incised palmette with alternating black and red petals; inscription on top of rim.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the Panathenaic amphora by Lydos, Halle University 560 (Bentz 1998, pl. 3, no. 6.002).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0041) (Phase 1)
